long:
Meaning: to "fasten" upon; hence, to "seize", "be strong" (figuratively, "courageous", causatively "strengthen", "cure", "help", "repair", "fortify"), "obstinate"; to "bind", "restrain", "conquer".
Usage: aid, amend, Ã— calker, catch, cleave, confirm, be constant, constrain, continue, be of good (take) courage(-ous, -ly), encourage (self), be established, fasten, force, fortify, make hard, harden, help, (lay) hold (fast), lean, maintain, play the man, mend, become (wax) mighty, prevail, be recovered, repair, retain, seize, be (wax) sore, strengthen (self), be stout, be (make, shew, wax) strong(-er), be sure, take (hold), be urgent, behave self valiantly, withstand.
Source: a primitive root;
